category: Forms of Mass Passenger Transit with a Dedicated Operator
explanation: Airplane, Bus, Train, and Ferry are all forms of transportation that typically carry multiple passengers and require a dedicated, licensed operator (pilot, driver, captain). A Bicycle is a personal, self-operated mode of transport.

Christopher Columbus, Ferdinand Magellan, Vasco da Gama, and James Cook were all prominent maritime explorers during the European Age of Discovery. Neil Armstrong was an astronaut and the first person to walk on the Moon, making him an explorer of space rather than Earth's oceans and continents.
Pint, Pound, Acre, and Mile are all units used to measure physical dimensions (volume, mass, area, and length respectively). Minute is a unit of time.
